title: Old Mortality, Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: When the Highlanders were returning from England on     their route to Glasgow, in the year 1745-6, they plundered Mr.     Paterson's house at Gatelowbrigg, and carried him a prisoner as far     as Glenbuck, merely because he said to one of the straggling army,     that their retreat might have been easily foreseen, as the strong     arm of the Lord was evidently raised, not only against the bloody     and wicked house of Stewart, but against all who attempted to     support the abominable heresies of the Church of Rome.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: To make j'ou some amends for what, before you reach this paragraph, you will have suffered, I enclose j'ou two poems I have carded and spun since I past Glenbuck.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
